meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a brad.
meanings.sent2: He always bradded the corners of the carpet.
meanings.sent3: The teacher bradded the artwork to the bulletin board.
meanings.sent4: The chef bradded the ingredients together to create a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter bradded the pieces of wood with precision.

meanings.sent2: She admired the bradded details on the furniture.
meanings.sent3: The bradded edges added a unique touch to the design.
meanings.sent4: The bradded fabric held up well over time.
meanings.sent5: The bradded door had an elegant finish.

meanings.definition: The past tense of the verb 'brad'.
meanings.sent1: He used a bradded to fix the loose board.
meanings.sent2: The bradded was essential for the repair.
meanings.sent3: She found the old bradded in the toolbox.
meanings.sent4: The bradded completed the task efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The bradded was a small but crucial tool in his collection.
